direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check for the presence of an option, but one checks for long options and the other for short or long options.
Both methods check for the presence of an option, but one checks for short options and the other for short or long options.
Both methods involve querying the presence of an option, but getOption returns the Option object if it exists.
Both methods modify the state of the Options object by adding or checking for options.
Both methods access the options stored in the Options object, but getMatchingOptions returns a list of matching options.

enhanced_by.reason: Adding an option is necessary to set up the state for testing the presence of an option.
Adding an option group can affect the state of the Options object, which is relevant for testing the presence of an option.
Retrieving an option can be part of the test setup to ensure the option is present before checking its presence.
The result of hasLongOption can be used to assert the presence of a long option, which is similar to asserting the presence of any option.
The result of hasShortOption can be used to assert the presence of a short option, which is similar to asserting the presence of any option.
